summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center memorandum detailing a suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019. Staff responded to his cell after his cellmate reported the incident, found Epstein with a homemade rope around his neck, and performed life-saving measures before he was removed from the unit.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who attempted suicide by hanging in his cell in the Special Housing Unit.

persons.name: Wm Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who alerted correctional officers to Epstein's suicide attempt.

persons.name: Ops Lt.
persons.context: The recipient of the memorandum and a supervisor who arrived to assist during the incident.

persons.name: S/O
persons.context: A security officer who heard the noise and assisted in responding to the incident.

connections.description: They were cellmates in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The security officer responded to the incident, entered Epstein's cell, and performed chest compressions.
The Operations Lieutenant arrived to assist during the suicide attempt response.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to hang himself in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center using a homemade orange rope. His cellmate alerted officers, who intervened and performed life-saving measures.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
Special Housing Unit, M tier, Cell 124
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide by hanging in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 23, 2019.
The attempt was discovered by his cellmate, Wm Tartaglione, who alerted correctional officers.
Epstein was found with an orange homemade rope around his neck, was breathing but unresponsive.
Correctional staff performed chest compressions and removed him from the Special Housing Unit.
This incident occurred approximately three weeks before Epstein's death in the same facility.
